linear.matrix

Class SymmetricFloatMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • linear.matrix.SymmetricFloatMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataMatrixInterface

    public class SymmetricFloatMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataMatrixInterface
    In this variant diagonal elements do exist (they are not equal to zero).

      • getMatrix2DArray

        public float[][] getMatrix2DArray()
        Returns:

      • isSymmetricMatrixImplementation

        public boolean isSymmetricMatrixImplementation()
        Description copied from interface: DataMatrixInterface
        This method does not in fact check for symmetry in the specific matrix but rather returns an indicator of whether the specific implementation enforces that matrix be symmetric or not. Some of the implementations that do also save space by only holding one copy of m(i,j) and m(j,i).
        Specified by:
        isSymmetricMatrixImplementation in interface DataMatrixInterface
        Returns:
        True, if for each i,j it holds that m(i,j) = m(j,i).

      • isSquare

        public boolean isSquare()
        Specified by:
        isSquare in interface DataMatrixInterface
        Returns:
        True if the number of rows equals the number of columns, false otherwise.

      • loadDMatFromFileNoDiag

        public float[][] loadDMatFromFileNoDiag(java.io.File dMatFile)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Load the matrix from a file where its diagonal elements are not given (they are all equal to zero).
        Parameters:
        dMatFile -
        Returns:
        Two-dimensional array that is a symmetric float matrix without the diagonal, each row i contains only elements m(i,j) for j > i.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
